page.title: 09Education After 11 years
page.content: In south Warwickshire there is a selection of schools at 11 years of age.All children transfer to a senior school but the choice of school to some degree is based on an examination called the 11 plus .Those children with the highest intelligence quotients are offered places at King Edward V1 Grammer school ,Stratford _Upon_Avon(boys) or The Stratford Grammer School for Girls at Shottery Manor.The majority will transfer to a High School in the area.The one for this area is Kineton High School(1275 on roll).There are senior schools in Leamington,Stratford and Warwick if places are available.Transport is not provided to schools outside the catchment area.Two colleges of Further Education,one in Stratford_upon_Avon ,the other in Leamington Spa,are available for vocational courses.
